reviewText:
PAYDAY: The Heist is not an ordinary FPS shooter. This game is the reason for my avatar on Steam, even. PAYDAY: The Heist is a beautiful combination of variety, interesting replayability, and tons of fun! It is on par with other shooters, yet it retains it's ability to keep you engulfed in becoming from a small-time offender to a hardened career criminal who knows his way around an Overkill 145+ heist.

You start off with a simple pistol and assault rifle, your later best friends and life-savers. But as you continue to play more, you'll get more eager to see the heist stand out it's varied script events and interesting turn-outs that will manage to keep you playing for hours with friends, until you probably reach Level 15. From there on, you're on you're on your way to Level 145 (or, for the DLC owners, 193).

The gameplay is certainly well done. Repeating myself, it is on par with other popular and mainstream shooters like Call of Duty, but it does not show it at all.  While it can be blamed for being a little too much Left 4 Dead, it is still great. You play as the bad guys this time, and the good guys try to stop you. So, in common sense, what do the bad guys do? Kill them, of course! You can choose to be silent and get out with tons of cash without anyone noticing, or go the idiot's way and blast your way in, guns-blazing. This encourages further teamwork and demands faster reflex so you can make it out alive with the loot you've gotten. The guns are big enough to be embedded in the gameplay. It is of absolute necessity to choose your guns wisely, as a gun in it's wrong scenario can cause a lot of troubles for you and your team. As you continue dominating the map, the police switch tactics, and you must watch your backs from then on, because the police in this game are not dumb. The police will always try to outrun you in terms of tactics, sometimes even try to fool you, as they work in formations and form deadly teams. The Bulldozer is definently something you must avoid. Cloakers play hide-and-seek at times. Tazers are your death sentence if you go alone, and the Shield is a fool that must be fooled most of the time, as they run out trying to kill you instead of watching their backs. The maps are linear and have a touch of exploration. There is NEVER a big part of the map you will not be forced to go to, and it is absolutley not straight. Every map is divided in areas and is large enough for the heist to make you explore the area as you do objectives. Explorating is also encouraged as there are money bundles hidden anywhere. Heat Street is definently rectified, but that is only one heist to challenge you, and it is completely optional!

The gunplay is amazing. It has weight to it, unlike other games (cough CoD cough). When you kill a special unit, you'll feel good, because you've just brought down one of the police's top-notch units. And that is not all. Literally, the recoil, the sounds of the guns will keep you livid to kill more cops, as well as confident enough to go in deeper during an Assault wave and slaughter an entire police team. It's also very well-paced.

The graphics may not be super high-tech like many other companies aim to do now again, but the environments on some maps are gorgeous and well-executed enough to immerse you. It manages to suceed, even if the game is more enticed on it's gameplay rather than graphics.

The audio is superb! The voice acting for Bain and other characters is so good, the yells are powerful, and even the police is listenable and has some interesting quotes. The sound effects for the environments, explosions, and firefights is intense. The explosions sometimes feel weak and feeble, but everything else makes up for it.

The leveling is something I have a problem with ONLY. You start off with nothing except a pistol, a perk, and an assault rifle. This makes heisting very hard, as you're practically standing naked. I know this was designed so you can play with higher-leveled friends, but for people who need a boost so they can at least play better and support their team in multiplayer later on, this can be a tad frustrating or tedious, because even Easy can be hard for some players. But in every other aspect, I want nothing changed in this game.

PAYDAY: The Heist executes all the moves from games of today, and fits it in one tight, playable package that is sure to keep you enthralled for more. Even if it's sequel, Payday 2, is now a grind-fest, ahem, and inferior game gameplay-wise to this one, I would recommend PAYDAY: The Heist for players looking for something new, fresh and with action.

9.5/10

reviewText:
Do you like like co-operative games?

If you like the Left 4 Dead series, you will find this game quite familar, yet very different, and possibly much more difficult in some ways.

Become a fearless criminal along with three like-minded individuals (or bots) and perform a variety of daring heists that will almost never be the same. This game will pretty much test your First Person Shooter skills as well as the mutual cooperation between your teammates.

The relentless police will send everything they got after you, so you won't be able to idle around for long, and have to use the precious time between each assaults to move around, complete your objectives, reload and prepare for the next one.

Pick your own gear for each mission. And as level up you gain experience to unlock new weapons, new abilities and new perks to help yourself and your teammates.
Be quick, be sharp, be smart, and always remember to stand together.

You will find yourself having to rely on your crew to get you out of trouble, so be prepared to learn and do the same as well.

Alas, I highly recommend giving this game a try. Its entertainment value, affordable price tag and its interesting co-operative gameplay shouldn't disappoint.

reviewText:
A seriously amazing co-op shooter. Can literally only be described as a 'Police Genocide them-up' but by god is it a lot of fun.
This game combines good teamwork and co-op gameplay, with big, detailed maps and brilliant characters to create a heisting experience that would blow most other FPS/Co-Op games out of the water.

I got my £20 (With one of the best DLCS ive seen included) out of this within the first two heists.

Need I say more? Just go buy this, you won't regret it.

25/10

reviewText: Much better than Payday 2. It lacks some features such as more advanced stealth and skill trees from Payday 2 but the gameplay is much better. There are no micro-payments, no skins. Speaking of DLC. there is only one availible, and it adds much more than so called DLC's" or money grabs in PD2. It adds 2 new heists
recommended: new weapons and the best part is that if your friends don't have the DLC maps they can still play with you if one player has the DLC! The levels are challenging and fun
hoursPlayed: the gameplay feels more tactical and Co-Op focused. I strongly reccomend this game over the "sequel"."

reviewText:
There's a burning question in the PAYDAY community that is: Should you buy the first or the second one?

This is a tough question. And this review will be a little different kind of review because I am answering your question right there.

PAYDAY: The Heist is a clunky mess. But there's just something in the game that you can't just shout I ♥♥♥♥ING LOVE IT". PAYDAY had more character
recommended: more additude than the second one and that's why I will always remember the day I finally got to play this game. It was on PS3 and my mind was blown with how awesome it was to play the game. It felt so right to do wrong; killing cops and stealing ♥♥♥♥ felt amazing! The game had something so unique compared to most of the FPS games at the time. And the gameplay still holds up even today.\n\nAnyways
hoursPlayed: that's that for the nostalgia. Now the the real part of the review. What makes PAYDAY better than PAYDAY 2? The heists. The content. The difficulty. PAYDAY: The Heist heavily relys on the team play rather than making the enemies insanely overpowered (like in PAYDAY 2) and makes you think what kind of stuff you are going to bring with you. This is something PAYDAY 2 doesn't have. Variety! PAYDAY: The Heist has variety in the Heists so you really need to think about what you're bringing with you. PAYDAY 2 has a bit more... straightforward heists.\n\nSo which one should you buy? I fyou are a big fan of the game: both. If you want to play with your friends: PAYDAY: The Heist. If you are a newcomer to the whole PAYDAY thing: I would suggest for you to get PAYDAY 2 GoTY."

reviewText: Really fun!\nAlthough I haven't gotten Payday 2, I feel that this game has realistic graphics (not too realistic though, a bit cartoon-ish) , and the gameplay was complete throughout. However, it isn't as easy as you think. Although there are around 3 or 4 objectives in a game/map, you have to either face tons of Assaults moving forward (depending on difficulty), restart drills (an objective), or just hold the fort until the thermite/drill/etc. is done. Despite all these challenges, the game itself is really intense at some point, including stealth and assault missions. 10/10 would play again! :D

reviewText:
There's a burning question in the PAYDAY community that is: Should you buy the first or the second one?

This is a tough question. And this review will be a little different kind of review because I am answering your question right there.

PAYDAY: The Heist is a clunky mess. But there's just something in the game that you can't just shout I ♥♥♥♥ING LOVE IT". PAYDAY had more character
recommended: more additude than the second one and that's why I will always remember the day I finally got to play this game. It was on PS3 and my mind was blown with how awesome it was to play the game. It felt so right to do wrong; killing cops and stealing ♥♥♥♥ felt amazing! The game had something so unique compared to most of the FPS games at the time. And the gameplay still holds up even today.\n\nAnyways
hoursPlayed: that's that for the nostalgia. Now the the real part of the review. What makes PAYDAY better than PAYDAY 2? The heists. The content. The difficulty. PAYDAY: The Heist heavily relys on the team play rather than making the enemies insanely overpowered (like in PAYDAY 2) and makes you think what kind of stuff you are going to bring with you. This is something PAYDAY 2 doesn't have. Variety! PAYDAY: The Heist has variety in the Heists so you really need to think about what you're bringing with you. PAYDAY 2 has a bit more... straightforward heists.\n\nSo which one should you buy? I fyou are a big fan of the game: both. If you want to play with your friends: PAYDAY: The Heist. If you are a newcomer to the whole PAYDAY thing: I would suggest for you to get PAYDAY 2 GoTY."

Get into a bank with 3 weapons, bulletproof vest, and bags? No problem!
Wear a mask? OH MY GOD HE'S GOT A MASK KILL HIM!

What is wrong about it? You can't do it.

Staying on the roof waiting for a heli-guy to drop you C4s on the roof? Sure, why not.
What happens? Guy drops it 6 floors lower on the ground.

Stealing blood from a hospital known in L4D? Huh. Well, okay.
What happens? Wrong guy.

FACTS:
99.98% of America's residents are policemen
Cloakers play soccer
No drills in America work properly
Same with saws
and everything else

reviewText: This game is fantastic! If anyone is thinking about buying this then get it! It is one of those few games that make you feel rewarding and make you want to do more things. Payday The Heist is about four guys, Dallas, Hoxton, Wolf and Chains. You get to choose who you want to paly as and what heist you want to do. As you play and beat heists you will get money which is what you use to level up your class. There are 3 (4 if you get the DLC) classes that you get to level up. Each class has different weapons, crew bonuses and bags. The difficulty of the heists depend if you want to just have a normal experience. Overkill if you want to go hard. And easy which is only for the two heists for people who just started playing the game. Over all, this game is a fantastic FPS. If you are choosing to buy which Payday to buy first, get this one for starters. And remember, SHOOT THE BULLDOZER IN THE FACE!

reviewText: Decided to come back to this from Payday 2, and this game does not ♥♥♥♥ing dissapoint.  Whereas Payday 2 has more options and an RPG style progression, Payday: The Heist is much more linear in how the game unfolds.  You can unlock all of the skills in the game, there are a small selection of weapons, and at most the skills" are designed to work around a party of 4.\n\nWhat this game lacks in choice
date: it makes up for one of the best heist/action movie simulators you're going to play in a long damn time.  Straight up recreations of scenes from movies
recommended: or entire movies themselves.  Rather than throw 20+ different options to complete at a heist at you
hoursPlayed: you often have one objective to complete at a time
voteText: often with dozens of cops throwing themselves at you.\n\nHoled up on a rooftop with SWAT climbing up the sides and jumping from adjacent buildings at you? Check.  Fighting your way down a crowd downtown street
helpfulPercent: chasing a traitor who stole your cash ala HEAT? Check.  Sneaking into a highrise building to steal a buttload of diamonds while holding various corporate members hostage for negotiation?  Check and check.\n\nThe graphics have aged a bit
votesHelpful: being a 5 year old game
votesTotal: but they get the job done and it's well optimized.  The music is absolutely amazing
votesFunny: and in many aspects I would count it as better than Payday 2's soundtrack.  Rather than dubstep/DnB tracks

column16: giving it a lower key but higher overall intensity feeling to the shootouts.  Rather than spending the entire match in a constant shootout with cops regardless if there's an assault in progress or not

column19: which slowly builds up as you fight your way up the derelict apartment building to the saferoom filled with cash.\n\nAt $15 this game is a steal

reviewText: PAYDURR: The HURRR is a game about 4 (four!) special education graduates who decide to rob banks, moms basement, their drug dealers house, and a meat packing plant. They start all of their heists with some dude who has a kickass plan to do everything without a hitch and get away clean, but naturally our downsy antiheroes screw it up by walking in without masks shouting and then shoot police instantly. The heists usually go downhill from there until somebody smacks a drill on something, but being special-ed superstars they cant even get that right, having to go back and hit it several times until they get the drill right. Eventually they go into a vault/safe/moms basement and fill bags with money, leave them on the ground, then run away giddy with the 'millions they totally just made and will never have to work again' which equates to their share of rent at the group home and a few trips to mcdonalds. In summary a more realistic and addictive game than cowadooty. 7/10 would DURR again.

reviewText:
I will admit right off the bat, I'm not good at writing reviews. I will also admit that I do not care. This game deserves a review, and it's getting one. Anywho...

PAYDAY: The Heist is, well, a bank heist simulator. Basic stuff: walk into a bank, put on a mask, shoot guards, keep civilians in check, etc. Also, if your computer is as bad as mine, you're destined to have framerate issues unless you have a custom config. I can understand this, because the graphics are amazing, the animations are realistic, and the amount of effort put into this game is overwhelmingly great. I bought this during the Winter Sale, at a low price of $2. Trust me, it's worth more than that. Its actual price is great for such a great game.


+Awesome graphics
+Realistic
+Great price
+Satisfies your criminal needs

-Frustrating at moments, but that's part of the fun.
-THOSE DAMN TASERS

Overall 9/10

reviewText:
This game has changed my life.

Never again will I be able to go out in public and not instinctively scout out every single security camera in the area.
Never again will I be able to make a deposit at the bank, without singling out the branch manager.
Never again will I be able to sit in the reception of a hospital, without having to constantly fight the burning urge to get up and shout at everyone to GET DOWN ON THE GROUND!".
Never again will I be able to peacefully enjoy a barbecue party hosted by the neighbor
date:
without subconsciously wondering whether or not he's printing counterfeit currency in his basement.


Easily a 10/10

Payday the Heist it the grand sucessor, which Payday 2 is a sequel. Payday 2 players might find Payday THe heist a bit too chalenging since Payday 2 has the dificulty set to ♥♥♥♥♥ mode.
The Gameplay: The Gameplay is simpler but a lot more fun than Payday 2. Of course the drills still break down,but three weapons, crew bonuses, insta upgraids in heists if you level up and much much more keeps it better
The Graphics: The graphics engine is good only the masks look ugly as ♥♥♥♥ in game. Nothing else really. The graphics ain't Payday 2 ofcourse but it's up there.
THe Sound: The sound in the game is amaizing. From the talking of bank customers and employes to the SWAT radio chatter sounds realistic. The Soundtrack is up there with the best soundtracks of 21st centurie: Hotline Miami and Mirrors Edge are a bit better tho.
All in all I rate this game Scarlet Johansen aka 10/10 \( ͡° ͜ʖ (͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)/ ͜ʖ ͡°)/ʖ ͡°)/

reviewText:
The PAYDAY crew are here to rob banks, houses and hospitals.

Featuring a colourful and funny cast of varying countries of origin and personalities

Hoxton the funny and my personal fav character from Sheffield, South Yorkshire, England.

Dallas the calm, collected American member of the group and refered to by most as the group leader.

Wolf the psychopathic member of the group, from Vallentuna, Sweden.

Chains another american who is ex military and this games support.

The game is incredibly fun and like its sequel is full of re-playability and brilliant gameplay, I personally love the co-op in this game and its a great way to spend time with friends and have a good laugh .

9/10

reviewText:
If you watched and like movies about robbery as Point Break (1991) or Heat (1995), you will be delighted. Because each megabyte of Payday: The Heist full of references to these movies... and  to many others.

Pros:+ A unique concept of cooperative game.
+ Beautiful and minimalist design.
+ Excellent balance.
+ Hardcore.
+ Additional capabilities (variability, in-game experience, challenges, customization)
+ Crossover with the Left 4 Dead Universe (easter eggs, additional heist NO MERCY)
+ Fair price (the game was distributed for free of charge during Crimefest)
+ There is only 1 paid DLC (except OST) and no microtransactions (as in PayDay 2)

Features:• Strong, but a modest content (like in Left 4 Dead)
• Unideal AI (but much more smartest than in Killing Floor)
• The game has no support by developers anymore (but it works perfect)
• As a result - there is no anti-cheat (recommended to play with friends)

Cons:- Some things should be realized much better (optimization, stealth mode, perks menu)
- No support for custom modifications.

8/10
Outcome:ᅠPayDay: The Heist - a revolution in a particular genre of games. Cooperative robbery, wow!
No more zombies, infected or mutants. Just cops and robbers. But there is a special squad, which is ready to kick your аss. And believe me, you have to make an effort that did not happen.
ᅠCharacters, dialogues, sets and music - everything points to a lot of cult thrillers and action movies. This game literally consists of explicit and implicit references to ones. You will visit the deja vu on UNDERCOVER heist, in all senses.
ᅠUndoubtedly, the product has some flaws. But it is necessary to take into account, that Payday: The Heist - debut(!) of Overkill Software (an independent studio at the time). It's made with lots of love, and isn't overly commercialized like PayDay 2.
ᅠPayday: The Heist is able to gift you and your friends a lot of pleasant evenings and it is can be buyed during steam sale for a song. With this game you can to be in robber's shoes, not robbed. And, in case you are a big cinephile (like me), you will find yourself in paradise.

reviewText:
This game is the 4-player co-op Left 4 Dead wanted to be!

While in Left 4 Dead we were promised to get changing missions and alternative ways to finish them, they always stay the same - beside the different spawn(rate/places) of the enemies. In Payday the missions change: in lower difficulties only in details, but in higher ones you sometimes get other objectives.

You get a nice set of different Heists to fullfil. Even a big homage to its main inspiring model Left 4 Dead by giving you the opportunity to play the non-canon events that leads to the outbreak of the infection.

If you like such 4-player co-op games with real teamwork you should give this game a try!

Not to forget it is a nice 'gun porn'. ;-)

reviewText: If you have friends to play with, this is probably one of the best co-op games on the PC market right now - not including PAYDAY 2. On almost every map you have a choice - do it quietly or loudly. The first option is saving your bullets and blood for some time, obviously. This game has some RPG elements ( like leveling and three classes - fourth class can be obtained by buying a DLC ). You level up by getting money ( money = exp points here ), which is nice. Every class has other weapons that can be unlocked by just playing. I played every possible not-dlc level and I had great time playing the game. I would rate it 8/10 though for not that much weapons and heists.

reviewText:
- many cheaters
- sometimes AI
- more and more players start play payday 2

+/- bugs (It´s up to you if you use it or not like: Helping your downed friend through the wall)

+ Prize and also DLCs (only 2)
+ 4 characters, and each with funny quotes
+ a lots of different types of masks
+ COOP for 4 players
+ 145 levels (193 with DLC)
+ weapons, crew bonuses, bags ( - less than in PAYDAY 2)
+ many types of law forces
+ steam adds (interesting achievements, trading cards, statistics etc.)

So, I am very big fan of this Coop game, where you take a role like one of the 4 robbers (Dallas, Hoxton, Chains and Wolf). You start with M4 and M9 pistol like level 0 (there is reputation, not level) and you will stealing jewelery, gold or money in 8 maps (with DLC). Yeah, the true is that if you played PAYDAY 2 I think you won´t like it, cause here´s only a few weapons and upgrades, bonuses, and not a RPG part like in payday 2. But If you won´t play PAYDAY 2 or If you was big fan of Payday 2 and you wanna take a look How our group looks before Hoxton gets to Prison you should buy it.

All in all: 92%

reviewText:
This is an extremely addictive and challenging first-person shooter. It isn't necessarily the best game around, but it definitely is fun to play. There is a lot of farming involved with leveling up, but as you farm, your character gets better and you get more improved weapons. There is never a dull moment. Due to the randomization of the enemy spawn locations, no two levels are exactly the same. A guard could burst through a door in a level where that never happened before. The game keeps you on the edge of your seat, and it has the classic effect of making you want the rage quit once you die.

However, the main setback of this game is that the AI (or your teammates) are absolutely terrible. They run about as fast as a rabbit with two broken legs, and you have to stop sprinting in order for them to keep up with you. Also, when you are down and are bleeding out, you usually have to shout out to them in order for them to actually come to your aid. But, setting this drawback aside, if you have friends to play with, the game will still be a fantastic co-op experience.

My overall rating for this game will have to be an 8/10. It's not the best game in the world, but it is FAR from being the worst.

reviewText:
One of the best co-op games ever, IMO (Just behind Left 4 Dead 2).

Pros:
Lots of fun with friends
Good graphics
Good level design and objectives
Awesome soundtrack
Likeable characters (Hoxton is my favourite)
You can invite your friends to the DLC heists even if they don't own the DLC themselves

Cons:
Lots of grinding to level up and unlock upgrades
Not many people play this game now since the release of PAYDAY 2

Still, I would highly recommend this game if you have friends that enjoy co-op games.

reviewText:
Payday: The Heist........Great game overall and all round fun but let's get real about this.....I'm a robber who has earned millions already and now I'm robbing a bank.....Why can't I just get a decent drill to get the vault or whatever open. Sure it's part of the game but it get's to the point where you can't get decent drills.

Let's talk about the game and it's good parts. It's a fun game with friends esspecially the Diamond Heist Mission as you can do it all stealth mode and it's fast and easy and get's you a ton of cash. It maybe hard playing with other players online as there's a lack of communication but when you're playing with mates it's fun, suspenseful and rage inducing at times.

Overall, Payday: The Heist is a classic Cops Vs Robbers game where it's fast paced when you have to escape, suspenseful when you're going stealthy and the tension builds up as a ton of SWAT swarms around you when you're waiting for the drill to finish. 5 Star game with a few  downsides but none the less it's an amazing game with friends to play. I would recommend this game to anyone who is looking for an action packed game with mates.

-ŁogiX™

Every online or co-op game has the ''Player Factor'' of course but most players are helpful and enjoying to play with. There's some hackers but since it's a Player vs. Computer game, they're has no effect on you.

Buy this game, play this game, tell your friends about this game, make them play with you!

10/10 - Not the best game ever, but the strangest game mechanics and entertainment source ever.

reviewText:
Going back to play Payday The Heist after a haitus of of playing Payday 2 you see a solid game on par with the sequel, The Heist excels in everything it goes to accomplish except possibly Animations, But this was an early title for the company off the Xbox 360 so one would make a few exceptions for it looking a little stiff, What you come to see is an expertly crafted Horde Shooter with the horde being Common Cops to Swat that are hell bent to take you out on every heist you go on by throwing numbers over fire power at you in an attempt to take your gang and yourself out, On the flip side your set out with a standard pistol, and assault rifle to work towards unlocking other weapons and upgrade them by unlocking more for it to continue to progress yourself by taking money as a main replacement for XP, The game features 9 Heists with entirely different scenerios for each with each having their own enviorment to work in giving you room to breath and room for the cops to come at you, If your wondering if Payday: The Heist is worth checking out after playing Payday 2 and having enjoyed it then you will most likely enjoy this as well, It holds up to be on par in the same aspect as L4D1 is to L4D2 since both titles share the same systems and enemies.

The Game has 1 DLC in the form of the Wolf Pack, It includes 2 Heists a new Tree for unlocks [Weapons/Skills] and that's the extent, While seeming limited on the surface it is worthwhile to look towards getting this DLC on sale, Or simply with your purchase since it offers 2 compitent and well made maps that offer more to the expierence, Aswell as it gives you DLC for the second title Payday 2 in a similiarly named Wolf Pack that includes the same Maps and a Grenade Launcher  with a special Nail Gun as a melee.

Note: The Heists for The Heist are currently being ported over to Payday 2, While being similiar they often take twists on the old maps to make them better, Or simply update them as they take them over, If your willing to wait eventually all the heists from 1 will be in 2 at some point, Currently there's 4/9 Heists on 2 as of this review.

TL:DR: Payday: The Heist is a solid game and worth your time if your looking for something to play from time to time in the form of a horde shooter, It is on par with Payday 2 and holds up as it's own.

reviewText:
A very fun game full of catchy music, destruction, unique-ness (Is that a word?) And much more which even followed a sequel which took the good things of this game, and tweaked the bad things. But eh. This is a payday the heist review.

Anyways. Here are the pros of the game

- Great music to enjoy while killing cops

- Plenty of missions to do, which never get boring (Honestly, that ones an opinion.)

- Ways to stealth this game (Heck, It might not be as good as the Payday 2 Stealth but eh, not bad0

- Plenty of unique masks (A santa mask? What!?)

- Two words. Lag. Free.

And now we go onto the cons of the game.

- The A.I is a bit useless, which makes this game kinda force multiplayer

- It's a bit too easy (Seriously, Payday 2 gives much more challenges)

- Repetative (I know I said about how it never gets boring, but it's quite repetative.)


Well. I hope people who are reading this enjoy the game. And my terribleness as a review writer here. Anyways. Total score?

7.8

+ Great fun for friends

- A.I is mostly useless

+ Great music

+ Continued a great sequel

- Repetative

reviewText:
One of the best co-op games ever, IMO (Just behind Left 4 Dead 2).

Pros:
Lots of fun with friends
Good graphics
Good level design and objectives
Awesome soundtrack
Likeable characters (Hoxton is my favourite)
You can invite your friends to the DLC heists even if they don't own the DLC themselves

Cons:
Lots of grinding to level up and unlock upgrades
Not many people play this game now since the release of PAYDAY 2

Still, I would highly recommend this game if you have friends that enjoy co-op games.

reviewText:
I'll give it a 4.5/5 rating.

Even as an old game, and abandoned by Overkill to serve as a relic before PAYDAY 2.
I recommend this game because of it's CO-OP style of gameplay and action shooter.
It's like Left 4 Dead 2, but with guns, heists, and more ♥♥♥♥ to fight.

Enemies may get a wee bit annoying, but it's what adds up to the difficulty

The downside of this game that i had to remove 0.5 rating
Is because of the constant cheaters or hackers, they mess up the gameplay and some people don't find this fun and competitive at all.
Which is pretty bad, and the DEVs should add minor updates to fix this game that has some few broken things. I feel they should fix this game and update it alot more.

That's my review.

reviewText:
-Quick Review-
PAYDAY: The Heist is a first person shooter developed by OVERKILL Software and released in 2011. The game can be played solo, or as 4-player co-op, you get to Heist 6 zones/areas and depending on events that occur within the game your play experience will change.

-Detailed breakdown review-
Story:  There isn't much to say about the story behind PAYDAY: the Heist, it's basically four robbers (Wolf, Dallas, Hoxton, and Chains) who teamed up to Rob the First World Bank".

Game Play: As has already been said
date: the game plays as a FPS but instead of just mindlessly gunning down civilians and cops
recommended: you need to be careful about who you shoot (You are penalized for killing civilians)
hoursPlayed: and the game is objective oriented. In other words
voteText: "You could just kill cops for days
helpfulPercent: and your game would never end
votesHelpful: or you can kill as little as possible and get experience faster."\nThere is a level system within the game
votesTotal: you gain experience from picking up money/gems/currency
votesFunny: as you level up you unlock new weapons
commentsCount: tools
column16: and armor.\n\nAchievements: The achievements on PAYDAY: the Heist are TOUGH
column17: most of these require a solid team to play with
column18: or a lot of determination/practice/luck. I haven't taken the time to start working on these achievements yet
column19: I'm only sitting at 7 out of 56 achievements (05/18/15). I intend to try for more achievements
column20: but most of them require specific conditions to be met
column21: and "must be there at the start of the heist".\n\nPrice: PAYDAY: The Heist is priced at $14.99
column22: I personally picked up my copy on the 24 hour give away October 16
column23: 2014. I recommend waiting for a sale to purchase this game. However if you're really into 4-player FPS's this is your game
column24: and you can easily pump 20+ hours into this game
column25: thereby justifying the purchase at full price.\n\nConclusion: I've always felt that I'm not the best critic of these types of games since I spend most of my time playing by myself
column26: or with one other friend. I enjoyed playing PAYDAY: The Heist
column27: however I only played single player or with one friend.\nI would recommend this to people who already have friends they play 4 player games with
column28: I could see Left 4 Dead fans easily getting attached to this game - if looking for a different flavor of 4-player-FPS."

reviewText:
Going back to play Payday The Heist after a haitus of of playing Payday 2 you see a solid game on par with the sequel, The Heist excels in everything it goes to accomplish except possibly Animations, But this was an early title for the company off the Xbox 360 so one would make a few exceptions for it looking a little stiff, What you come to see is an expertly crafted Horde Shooter with the horde being Common Cops to Swat that are hell bent to take you out on every heist you go on by throwing numbers over fire power at you in an attempt to take your gang and yourself out, On the flip side your set out with a standard pistol, and assault rifle to work towards unlocking other weapons and upgrade them by unlocking more for it to continue to progress yourself by taking money as a main replacement for XP, The game features 9 Heists with entirely different scenerios for each with each having their own enviorment to work in giving you room to breath and room for the cops to come at you, If your wondering if Payday: The Heist is worth checking out after playing Payday 2 and having enjoyed it then you will most likely enjoy this as well, It holds up to be on par in the same aspect as L4D1 is to L4D2 since both titles share the same systems and enemies.

The Game has 1 DLC in the form of the Wolf Pack, It includes 2 Heists a new Tree for unlocks [Weapons/Skills] and that's the extent, While seeming limited on the surface it is worthwhile to look towards getting this DLC on sale, Or simply with your purchase since it offers 2 compitent and well made maps that offer more to the expierence, Aswell as it gives you DLC for the second title Payday 2 in a similiarly named Wolf Pack that includes the same Maps and a Grenade Launcher  with a special Nail Gun as a melee.

Note: The Heists for The Heist are currently being ported over to Payday 2, While being similiar they often take twists on the old maps to make them better, Or simply update them as they take them over, If your willing to wait eventually all the heists from 1 will be in 2 at some point, Currently there's 4/9 Heists on 2 as of this review.

TL:DR: Payday: The Heist is a solid game and worth your time if your looking for something to play from time to time in the form of a horde shooter, It is on par with Payday 2 and holds up as it's own.

reviewText:
I'll give it a 4.5/5 rating.

Even as an old game, and abandoned by Overkill to serve as a relic before PAYDAY 2.
I recommend this game because of it's CO-OP style of gameplay and action shooter.
It's like Left 4 Dead 2, but with guns, heists, and more ♥♥♥♥ to fight.

Enemies may get a wee bit annoying, but it's what adds up to the difficulty

The downside of this game that i had to remove 0.5 rating
Is because of the constant cheaters or hackers, they mess up the gameplay and some people don't find this fun and competitive at all.
Which is pretty bad, and the DEVs should add minor updates to fix this game that has some few broken things. I feel they should fix this game and update it alot more.

That's my review.

Its been overtaken now by its successor, but remains a very playable game. reviewText:
Do heists, kill cops, intimidate members of authority, and force information out of people from the top of businesses. Do what you want, get the job done how you want, and whether you live or die, pass or fail, at least you get to do it all behind a sweet-looking mask of your choice.

Money and experience is used to level up and to unlock new weapons, skills, and masks. Upgrade the perks and skills in the order you want, to suit you and your style of playing the game.

4 playable crims to choose from: Dallas, Hoxton, Wolf, and Chains. Get money the fun way, and see you at the safe house!

9/10 would throw a man out of a helicopter again.

reviewText:
Pro's
- You get new weapons each time you level up.
- It almost never gets boring playing the same mission.
- Co-op is available, so you get to play with other people or buds.
- Although this game isn't recent, OVERKILL made a new game as a sequel to this. (Payday 2, so more gaming is available).

Con's
- When someone is joining your game. (Already started) You'll have to wait a few. (Depending on their internet connection.) But you can disable that.
- Payday The Heist isn't getting updated due to the recent game that OVERKILL released (Payday 2).

In general, this game is awesome, and very fun to play with others. If you liked Payday The Heist, check out Payday 2!

reviewText: Payday is a fun co-op game, but it lacks polish.\n\nThe maps are of uneven quality and difficulty. There is frequently a feeling of what do I do next?” with inadequate guidance from the game. It helps to play with experienced players
recommended: you're dragging your team down because you don't have all the levelling perks that they do.\n\nThere also seem to be many ways to game each level. Beating levels seems to be less about adapting on the fly
hoursPlayed: and more about knowing exactly where to hide out while you're waiting for events to happen. And you do spend a lot of time in this game waiting for stuff to happen.\n\nBut past the flaws
voteText: Payday is a game with a cheap $20 price tag. There is a certain breeziness to the gameplay that's just a rollicking good time.  The harder difficulty levels require teamwork and planning
helpfulPercent: which I appreciate. Payday delivers a satisfying co-op experience
votesHelpful: of which there are too few today. Really – if judged solely for its “co-op-iness”
votesTotal: this game is top-flight… playing on a well-coordinated team is a great experience.\n\nI want to mention that you kill a lot of cops in Payday. A lot.  There's no stealth element here. Through the years

reviewText:
Super fun game. I enjoy how I get to level my character and unlock items and abilities. Super fun to play with a full party of friends. Interesting levels, the difficulty settings are good. I particularly enjoy difficult settings and play on hardest difficulty whenever I can, this game certainly can be difficult on harder settings and is no easy feat.

I was gifted it when it was on Sale a friend bought a 4 pack for like 6 or 8 bucks an I was lucky enough to be gifted it. It was so good, I bought the game on a 2$ coupon sale I unlocked from a badge I made with steam trading cards, and gifted a friend, who then in turn gifted HIS friend a copy as well so we could all play together. WILL be uploading some expert level heists onto my YouTube channel hopefully in the next couple weeks. Great game, hope I am lucky enough to be able to play the second one as well. Well worth the deal, would still even pay 10 bucks for it.

8/10

reviewText:
This game is for everyone... you can play it as many times as you want and play it differently every time. It has enough variety to keep you entertained for hours on end.

You can play stealth in the Diamond Heist... or all out aussault in the Bank Heist. It's not a completely level based game, if you start you can easily learn the controls and become adept quickly.

An overall good game. I would recommend to almost everyone. 9/10

reviewText:
Pro's
- You get new weapons each time you level up.
- It almost never gets boring playing the same mission.
- Co-op is available, so you get to play with other people or buds.
- Although this game isn't recent, OVERKILL made a new game as a sequel to this. (Payday 2, so more gaming is available).

Con's
- When someone is joining your game. (Already started) You'll have to wait a few. (Depending on their internet connection.) But you can disable that.
- Payday The Heist isn't getting updated due to the recent game that OVERKILL released (Payday 2).

In general, this game is awesome, and very fun to play with others. If you liked Payday The Heist, check out Payday 2!

reviewText: An amazingly great game from when Overkill actually cared more about gameplay then profit. Much more fun than Payday 2, but crippled by a dying community, a lack of heists and poor stealth.  Much less bugs than Payday 2, so if you're sick of cloakers kicking you through walls, cameras seeing you through walls, audio glitches and random crashes, try playing this. Significantly harder than Payday 2, so if you enjoy playing loud missions, definitely pick this up. Also, the DLC is pretty fun.

reviewText:
I know what others say and think, but I could actually argue that the first PAYDAY is, in many ways, better than the sequel. The sequel giveth and it taketh away, but you're here to know why PAYDAY: The Heist is good. I'll cover the sequel in another review.

PAYDAY is what you get when you take Left 4 Dead and turn it into Cops vs. Robbers, and you're the robbers. You rob a big bank blind, steal cash from drug dealers in a spectacular way, loot gold from an intercepted armored transport, and more. You can level up three (four with DLC) skill trees to get different perks and guns, and as far as the guns go, there's something for everyone. Whether you like precision, crowd control, or the best of all worlds, there's a gun for you. There's not as many as there are in 2, but none of them are particularly useless (sans the starting pistol and Locomotive secondary shotgun, arguably, but that's beside the point).

This is by no means an easy game, so if you want a challenge, you won't be disappointed. You'll quickly discover that cover is your best friend, and teamwork and coordination are essential. The heists are massive in scale and are loads of fun to play, with the difficulty varying per heist. Fair warning: just because Heat Street is the second heist in the list doesn't mean it's only a small step up from First World Bank. It's actually one of the hardest heists in the game. You can level up to 145 without DLC, 193 with DLC. Not to mention, you can max out all available skill trees!

The majority of the player base has migrated to the sequel, but you can still find some servers, or set up your own. Grab some friends and give it a go; it's one of the good ones.

Also, just a tip for newcomers: if you join a First World Bank server and the host says something about overdrill
